For each molecule, atomic coordinates and calculated properties are stored in a file named dataset_index.xyz. The XYZ format (originally developed for the XMol program by the Minnesota Supercomputer Center) is a widespread plain text format for encoding Cartesian coordinates of molecules, with no formal specification. It contains a header line specifying the number of atoms n
a , a comment line, and n
a lines containing element type and atomic coordinates, one atom per line. We have extended this format as indicated in Table 2. Now, the comment line is used to store all scalar properties, Mulliken charges are added as a fifth column. Harmonic vibrational frequencies, SMILES and InChI are appended as respective additional lines.
